xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 27 May 2014
xwikidoc.content: <vijay13> has quit 08:53 <vijay13> has quit 13:11 <phenotips_org> has joined #phenotips 14:02 <mcupak> has quit 16:38 <phenotips_guest_> has joined #phenotips 17:01 <phenotips_guest_> Howdy, when building from the source code and deploying to Tomcat6 (following the instructions on http://phenotips.org/AdminGuide/Installation+on+Tomcat+and+MySQL), I get a page from XWiki with the message "We couldn't find any extension with id 'org.phenotips:phenotips-ui' and version '1.0-SNAPSHOT'. Make sure you have the right extension repositories configured". Do I need to add my local maven (~/.m2) repo into the x 17:03 <qwebirc29634> has joined #phenotips 17:05 <phenotips_guest_> has quit 17:06 <qwebirc29634> has quit 17:06 <phenotips_guest_> has joined #phenotips 17:07 <phenotips_guest_> (That logout/login was my bad - I'm the OP for the xwiki/repository question) 17:07 <sdumitriu1> Hi phenotips_ 17:07 <sdumitriu1> Hi phenotips_guest_ 17:08 <sdumitriu1> Indeed, the -SNAPSHOT version is not available in the registered repositories 17:09 <sdumitriu1> Depending on what you want to do, you can either register our nexus repository for snapshots, or register the local .m2 17:10 <qwebirc543674> has joined #phenotips 17:10 <qwebirc543674> (Yikes, obnoxious network issues, sorry about that) 17:10 <sdumitriu1> qwebirc543674: Did you get what I said? 17:11 <sdumitriu1> If not, check http://phenotips.org/IRC/phenotipsArchive20140527 17:11 <phenotips_guest_> has quit 17:12 <sdumitriu1> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Module+Repositories shows how to register it 17:13 <vijay13> has quit 17:13 <phenotips_guest_> has joined #phenotips 17:14 <phenotips_guest_> Yes, I did see your response, and thank you. So then is configuring for the local repository only important for making modifications to the PhenoTips layout? 17:14 <qwebirc543674> has quit 17:19 <sdumitriu1> There is another way 17:19 <sdumitriu1> Skip the dw 17:19 <sdumitriu1> Then import the .xar manually 17:19 <sdumitriu1> For that you'd need to activate the superadmin account 17:20 <phenotips_guest_> The dw? 17:34 <phenotips_guest_> Ah, Distribution Wizard 17:43 <phenotips_guest_> Great, thank you! I've imported the .xar through the "Upload new package" option, and now the UI loads. 17:48 <sdumitriu1> Perfect 17:55 <vijay13> has quit 18:09 <phenotips_guest_> As for UI changes, 18:10 <phenotips_guest_> Would sticking to this route require en/dis-abling the superadmin account in order to deploy new changes? 18:10 <phenotips_guest_> Or the other option, would configuring a production repository make updating the UI as easy as "updating extensions" as the normal admin user? 18:18 <sdumitriu1> If you don't wipe the database, you don't need the superadmin anymore 18:19 <sdumitriu1> But yes, Administration->Import is the right way 18:36 <phenotips_guest_> Awesome. Have a good evening! And thanks again, you've been incredibly helpful! 18:37 <phenotips_guest_> has quit
